New Records: Willy Adames tied the major league record with his 13th three-run homer of the season
Adames homered for the fifth consecutive game, matching the Brewers record shared by Jeromy Burnitz (1997) and Eric Thames (2017)
Key Match Events: Adames put the Brewers ahead 3-0 in the first with his 29th home run of the season
Jackson Chourio hit a grand slam
Rhys Hoskins also homered for the Brewers
Pedro Pag√©s hit a pair of solo home runs off Peralta
Chourio hit his second slam of the season in the sixth off Riley O'Brien
Post-Match Reflections: Adames went deep on his 29th birthday, tying the major league record with his 13th three-run homer
Adames expressed emotion and admiration for Ken Griffey Jr.
Adames is hitting.255 with a career-high 99 RBI
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rookie Jackson Chourio called the grand slam in the dugout earlier in the inning
Hoskins hit a two-run homer in the fourth
Peralta won his third consecutive decision
Others: Peralta allowed five runs, five hits and a season-high five walks in five innings
Milwaukee hit a two-run homer, three-run homer and grand slam in the same game for the first time since July 1, 2022
